reviews.content: Grapes: cabernet sauvignon 65%, merlot 30%, cabernet franc 2.5%, Petit verdot 2.5% Barrique 20 months (60% new) Richness and complexity at nose, blueberry, cherry, laurel, white pepper, licorice, tobacco, graphis. On the palate harmony, rich acidity, gentle tannins, roundness and softness. Long persistency and pleasant minerality. Ais Milano Masterclass Bordeaux 2009

One of the best Bordeaux money can buy. Opens up after an hour. Lots of red fruit and sweet earth and wood right now. Will develop to a more elegant complex masterpiece in 2-13 years. Best to wait to get ur full money's worth but it can drink now

Pr√© birthday Tasting üëå with my wine friends üç∑ A blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 4% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot. Tr√©s Pauillac nose with a lot of ripe cassis fruits, blackberries, graphite, cedar wood, tobacco, leather, full bodied on the palate, lush and silky, Incredibly powerfull and concentrated, flavors of cassis, blackcurrant, spices and licorice, well balanced with ripe tannin, Fantastic freshness, still young but mouthcoating delicious already !!! 100DSP
great tasting, ready to drink. Nice red color
Star if the show tonight. Was worried about the drink in window...this was spectacular.
Very good wine. Enjoyed it very much. I highly recommend it

Complex and well-structured flavors of plum, black cherry,licorice, tobacco, hint of chocolate and herbal undertones. Firm tannins are full of energy backed by balanced acidity(F). Multi-layered, elegant baby with great aging potential
Among the best I‚Äôve ever enjoyed! Especially notice the soft yet pronounced tannins. Beautifully balanced and complex. A real treat!
Complex nose with tones of black fruit and spices, silky tongue with medium to high tannins , superb wine i will try again as my first wine

A tale of two Sassicaias!! The 85 was enjoyed by my in-laws years before I came on the scene (but they saved me the bottle üòÜ) The 2016 is now in my hands Reportedly the 2 best vintages of the last 40 years I will see how long I can let the ‚Äò16 sleep!! Had the 2001 a few months ago thanks to Scott Serfas and it blew my mind If I could drink this kind of wine everyday I‚Äôd be a) a drunk and b) poor But smiling üòÉ

Let‚Äôs talk Sass‚Ä¶. Too ripe, to candy, to forward. It‚Äôs everything you ever wanted a decade (or 2) later. Sooooo I just bought a case and dear Vivino‚Ä¶.. you won‚Äôt see another review of sassy Guido for at least 4 (going on 14) years. Here‚Äôs my break down: this plum forward blackberry briar patch has a long‚Ä¶. Long way to go. I actually Only giving it 5 ‚≠êÔ∏è because I know it will be‚Ä¶.. but to much raw leather Hide, acid balance is spot on but waiting for fruits and chaulks to settle down a Notch.

From last week's Thursday Cabal meeting, theme of 100-point wines. Next up was the 2016 Sassicaia from Tenuta San Guido. I opened this 12 hours ahead of time, 6 of those hours in a decanter. Following the 2015 being Wine Spectator's #1 wine in the world, the 2016 followed up with 100-points from RP and Decanter. RP said "a wine of soaring achievement...this wine is chiseled and sharp with blackberry, ripe cherry, grilled herb and barbecue spice."
Enjoyed this wine a lot. Dark coulor. Blackcurrent, Cherry, chocholate, coffe and leather in the nose. A long powerful finish.
BIG but supple - super tannic but elegant, lots of dark red fruits and earth soil/leather. Cellar worthy but approachable now
Another perfect score for Ornellaia. Still the best value top tier reds. Dense, powerful, long finish. Blueberry, toasted bread, cedar, tobacco.
Typical high-end Napa Cab traits -- lush, smooth, balanced. Tobacco, leather, red/black fruit, yogurt. Simply a can't lose wine.

This wine is a true expression of the amazing selection of grapes and wines made atop Spring Mountain. This is everything I desire out of Napa Valley. Full-bodied, dark but smooth and balanced. In an "off vintage" this shines bright. Yogurt, blueberry, vanilla bean, chocolate. Incredible complexity. VIP Concierge Tasting (8 of 11)
Fabulous! !! Raspberry, clove. Full bodied and great tannins. Can't recommend enough
Wow. This bottle had a great smell when it was opened. It is great! It is a dark inky color with great legs and a smooth plum and blackberry flavor. It's a wonderful wine.
Fruit bomb!!! Excellent nose of crushed black currants, boysenberry leather and over ripened strawberry. Body intact. Low acidity, tannins have presented the fruit with integrity.

California Vacation Day 5 - Napa Valley Freemark Abbey Tasting: incredible wine, incredible aging. Solid dark fruit notes, palate and tannins were silky smooth, but well balanced with rich notes of leather & tobacco, hints of ginger dust.

B‚Äôday Boy Fooled!! This was served blind to me at my birthday back in early December. OMG! Completely fooled me (and Mrs A too). Could have sworn this was Barossa Shiraz!! Maybe McLaren Vale. HUGE WINE! Bold blackberry. Juicy stuff. Cured meat. Pipe smoke. Tar. Pepper. Super velvety. Eternal finish. Verdict: Wrong continent. No Shiraz in sight. This is CS 57%, Carmen√®re 20%, Merlot 12%, CF 6% and PV 5%. 18 months in French and American oak. Definitely going to revisit! Can‚Äôt wait to try again.
Chocolate, rich but elegant and complex. Just so nice to drink, it a great windows ..fantastic, Chile at its best! Just WoW!
This is the most iconic wine in Chile. When price is not getting outrageous, it's fortunate that I have already tasted a few.

wine.name: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Bolgheri Superiore 2016

reviews.content: 95. Outstanding! Dark fruit, crushed stone, deep earthy notes. This is some great juice. Will surely stand 10-15 years or more.
Wonderful meeting in the Roma!!! Great volume nose of sweet berries and fruits Super balanced, full bodied, volume blackberry, oak, raspberry, chocolate
Wet soil, red cherries, tobacco, oak, dusty tannins, medium plus acidity nicely balances the red fruit. Intense deep flavors yet light on the palate.
One of Parker 100 points, massive structure in a modern style. Has everything you want in a wine, But Needs time. Long Life ahead. 96+
And again!!! This wine never failed to impress!! True to 100 points as experts say!!! Balanced, elegant, delicate and some power but very well placed!!
Marvellous. Mineral nose with citrus, white flowers, peaches, Granny Smith and a hint of acacia honey. Straight with a good acidity and a very long finish.
ONE OF THE TOP #3 WINES FROM CHILE. DO YOU AGREE?
Unique blend of carmenere/cab/Syrah/petite Verdot. Dark fruits dominate blackberry, plum with smoky tobacco and pepper notes. Full bodied and amazing. Wish I had more. Pretty close to perfect.

Wow!! Wonderful wine to celebrate Easter with family. Bottle 1790 of 13500 produced in 2008 and they remained stored in subterranean pits of the winery until 2013. The blend is composed by 40% Carmen√®re, 30% CS, 15% Syrah and 15% Petit Verdot, unfiltered, aged for 14 months in new French oak, dark berries, vanilla and spicy on the nose. In the palate you find notes of coffee, spicy and figs. Long finishing of a full body and perfect balanced wine. RP93 and ST92 points. Happy Easter!

wine.name: Castillo Ygay Gran Reserva Especial Blanco 1998

reviews.content: One has to know great wine when he meets it. This one in particular is not my type and I won‚Äôt be pointing it as my all time favorite. Nonetheless, I cannot disagree that the wine is a masterpiece! Very smooth nose of sugary white fruits. Surprising freshness on the palate for a 30+ year old wine. Perhaps the most complex and developing aftertaste I have ever experienced. Not a single element which doesn‚Äôt lead to perfection.
What a stunning viura peach honey caramel oak and a very nice smooth body. Perfection
1986 vintage
The best carmenere I had in last couple years. Round palate in feel, solid acidity, berry, herbal notes combinate with spices and coca butter.
Notes of fig, nuts and cinnamon. Deep and intense purple color with flavor of blueberry, currant and black pepper! Perfect Carmere!!!
Off the charts good. Such well enveloped tannins with pepper and caramel slight jalape√±o on the nose too. Quintessential Carmenere!
Dried leaves tea some red fruits. Very round mellow lots of glycerin stile. Long finish and alcohol well integrated. Powerful but elegant pleaser!

A beautiful blend of Merlot, PV, Cab Sav, and Cab Franc, aged in new oak 15 months. It shows notes of rich caramel, charred wood, cherry liqueur, supple fruit, fresh tobacco, cola, chocolate, with a nice oak spice. The tannins are obviously bigger than Il Pino, but the wine is incredibly balanced, smooth and approachable. First vintage was 2006, 30k bottles produced. Fantastico! 98 points

This one was recommended to us today by the sommelier, I was a little bit unsure if it woul be worth the price, I must say it was totally worth it. Rich on the nose, strong beginning, very dense untypical compared to the Merlot I have tried so far. Dry finish and silky aftertaste. Hints of blackberry tobacco chocolate
2016 vintage
2017 vintage
2016 vintage
#Wine/dine afternoon with friends and girls. No notes taken, just enjoying the company, the wines and great food! 97 DSP
Extremely well sculpted wine. Tannins are in check. Elegant is the word. Even drinkable now. Ripe cherries. Beautiful specimen for a taste
Our first taste of Insignia we love it. Leather, smooth, good fruit. Vanilla. Unique and worth the extra $130 dollars above some of our expensive wines.

Happy Sangiovese Friday everyone! Shared this beauty with the visiting Texas Texas Ted. This is the 2015 Riserva from producer Podere Le Ripi. Their top end Brunello is called Lupi e Sirene (wolves and mermaids). Very approachable after a 4 hour decant. This has a wonderful earthiness to it, with notes of dark plum, Selene leather, vanilla, violets, and dusty cherry.
I thought the Brunello was good and then I had this and realized I knew nothing about Brunello. This is in a league of its own.
The reviews are spot on. It‚Äôs in a league that you rarely get to try, earthy, but soft and smooth. The craft of this wine is amazing.
A (my new favorite Carmenere! Berries and tobacco...chocolate. Me likes!)
Very smooth and balanced. A great Carmenere that has all the typical characteristics of the varietal without the rough edges you often find.
Exceptional wine with intense blackberry nose great depth and balance on palate with chewy fruit and long finish
After a long day of tasting Martinborough wines with JR. Very gd old world density. graphite cedar earthy cassis leather olive tapenade pencil lead
The same impressions drinking this bottle as tasting it a couple of weeks ago. It's just fantastic, and drinking so well at 8 years old. Top level stuff, no argument

Currently holding its cards very close to its chest. Not much nose to speak of at the start, quite dusty smoke with very subtle fruit. To me, as it opened up was feeling very simillar to the 2010 Pope just slightly more tannic and closed, yet so seamless and integrated. This is a monster in waiting and next to the 14 HDS had so much more weight in the mouth. Will be waiting a very long time before my next one.

My üíØth Rioja! What a beast. Double decanted for 3 hours and superbly youthful and alive. Muga' attempt to blend modern and traditional Rioja with higher alcohol, bigger fruit but still clear layers of secondary and tertiary notes. Oak, vanilla, dark chocolate, superbly balanced tannins and strict acidity. Massive, bold, gentle, structured. Love this 2000, but preferred the 98. At this level we're talking minor details though! üí•
My favor wine so far . I really recommend

93 pts Rioja ages in such a unique way, simply superb, poised at the point where wonderful tertiary aspects are making their presence felt. The med+ nose delivers mature oaked fruit, coffee, some cigar box, dark chocolate, showing its 17 years with grace and elegant power. The palate is balanced perfectly, bursting withlife with aged slightly sour cherry, full of confident red fruit, resolved tannin and palate that embraces from first sip to the the generous waves of an opulent finish.

The stellar 2003 Sena, even at 12 years, Is dark purple-colored with no bricking. It Presents grilled game, chocolate, clean damp earth, black fruits and baking spice. It skillfully combines power and elegance. Great now and many years of fantastic drinking ahead. Highly recommended.
Grear flavours strong bouquet oaky taste this is a great wine
Very good soft wine.
v12. Soft, dusty, candied cherry nose. Fresh, sour cherry fruit. Smooth, clean, bright, earth, dried herb and soft leather finish.

This is a beautiful Cabernet Sauvignon blend from an assortment of old vines around Chile: complex and layered with dark berry, spice, hedgerow, and cigar notes. It is the result of the Heritage Block project which is years of research into Chile's pre-phylloxera genetic material and old winemaking practices. Gorgeous!

@Home, 4Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£TN ! üéâüéâüéâ Finally done after having deep consideration which bottles I should open from here. üòÑüòÑüòÑ Superb balance, excellent & complex structure, well blended. Elegant CS partially due to moderate alcohol ! It displayed aroma of blackberry, cherry, oak, mint, vanilla, luscious herbs & spices with subtle smoke, & less leathery. Surprisingly less tannic & acidulous. Very smooth flow. I wonder how it is going to mature. Fenale lingering spices.
super super special wine. a must try for any wine aficionado. medium bodied perfect balance extraordinary comes at a price though
Light clear orange red. Roses and cherry. Feminine, elegant and delicate but with subtle power and intensity. Doesn‚Äôt get much better.

We had the 13 in Brunello, in Rosso and in Rosso mag‚Ä¶ my preference was in reverse of that order. Had the chance to try that wine again on its own a few weeks later and man! It‚Äôs so f_in good. Mind blowing good. But in a night of extreme luxury of vintages, this didn‚Äôt stand out the same as others. I know‚Ä¶
Tied WOTN with MR18. Big and bold cab led blend. More napa than Bordeaux. Ink like with medium grained tannin that kept going. leather blackcurrant cedar coffee

This has been the highlight of my wine experience out in New Zealand so far. Mind blowing good. No wonder James Suckling scored it a 97. Where to start? Tobacco, blackcurrant and burnt toast on the nose. Black cherry, vanilla and cassis on the finish. It may be one of the best reds I‚Äôve tasted.

The first time I‚Äôve tried a Stonebridge and this was impossible to fault. Blackcurrant and black Doris plum, over smoke and wood chip, bonfire almost, mint and clove. Smooth, long and intense. A perfect wine and the perfect vintage.

Wonderful white wine!!! green apple citrus vanilla oak minerals apple pear lychee stone cream peach butter saline tropical pineapple fennel elderflower melon lemon zest citrus zest grapefruit lemon gooseberry grass asian pear asian pear fresh grapes green melon apricot

Excellent and interesting wine. Sweet floral notes like elderflower, apricot, buttery popcorn and a hit of citrus zest on the nose. Delicate and savoury on the palate. Lots of minerality with light acidity and a saline finish.
Bright with green apple, minerals and lemon zest. So refreshing and deliciously complex!!
Absolutely stunning. High complexity. Violet nose. Very long finish. 30% graciano . They use 15000 plants tagged by gps spread across the property. The absolutely best plants are used.
Gift from Chistof fantastisk vin
Probably just past it's very best but still alive with ripe fruit, hints of violet, vanilla. Silky smooth tannins give way to a luxuriant finish displaying good oaky notes.

Pretty much everything you want from Napa Cab. Huge flavor, concentrated, dark color, and velvety tannins. The nose explodes even freshly opened. Dark flavors of creme de cassis, blackberry, blueberry, espresso, brown spices, and a hint of spring mountain herbs. Minute long finish and can be enjoyed for 10-15 years.
Wonderful explosion of elements. Profound raspberry, chocolate and cassis flavors with a velvety finish. No tannins
Cherry and tobacco to start. Mouthful of manilla. Incredible body.

Stunningly good. The nose is full of ripe plum and blackberries with plenty of vanilla French oak. The palate opens up full of dark fruit oak and spice. It has amazing length and silky tannins. However it‚Äôs got lots of aging potential. Now I just need to find another bottle !!!
This floats my boat. Dark fruits, vanilla and chocolate bit of pepper. Beautifully balanced. Softer, elegant Shiraz. Really nice.
4.4 big bold shiraz strong vanilla notes but really needs another 5-10 years bring it into its prime then I'm sure it'll be a knockout
Great aging, well kept . Just a great wine overall
I think this is one of my favorite years for stags leap.
A heavenly taste of napa

It‚Äôs aged well since 2012, which is a real testament to the winemakers. Cherry and red fruit still very present and tannins and old leather still present on the back end. Fully integrated bottle - no decanting needed.

Epic wine!! Floral orgasm! Violets. Red fruit, blue fruit, cardamom, vanilla, almond, and orange peel. Huge!! Spice structure stupid. Leather, licorice, tobacco, clove, juicy fruit, cr√®me de cassis, and slate. Finish last for minutes. Doesn‚Äôt get better than this.
Delicious in every way. Dry but not too tannin. Cherry fruit with awesome finish.
Such a beautiful wine. Silky texture. Packed full of black dark fruits, cassis, tobacco and liquorice. Spice on finish- long finish.
cocoa, coffee, creme de cassis, powerful, will age well. long finish. 96/100
This was a fantastic bottle of wine.. highly highly recommend.. sweet finish and a dry end...

PNP. Deep dark purplish color. Blueberry, boysenberry, and no. 2 pencil. Smooth, tongue drying palate. Firm, full tannins on the long finish. This score is completely based on potential, so take it with a grain of salt. This needs another year or two to enter it‚Äôs drinking window. All the raw materials are there.
Rich full nose, full body, developed but on the dry side. Got from Vintners. 15% Open 2 days, no longer dry and somehow slightly sweet with 2 yr cheddar
Bold, full body like I love
Deep red colour, plums and dark liquorice chocolate on the nose. This quintet of CS, merlot, cab franc, Malbec and petite Verdot is smooth on the palate and tannins are light on the finish. Wow.
Love the Mystae better than destinae in waiheke
lifted florals with some savoury characters and mouth watering acidity coming through

wine.name: Castello della Sala Cervaro della Sala 2018

reviews.content: Garden wine #6 and the best! Blend of 85% Chardonnay and 15% Grechetto Fermented and aged for 5 months in oak On the nose, chamomile, flinty minerality Stone fruits, melon, citrus. Vanilla cream and a touch of spice Perfectly balanced with fruit flavours of honeydew melon, white peach, pear, lemon zest Smoky and flinty minerality Buttery but not too rich Good acidity A touch of vanilla, spicy notes of nutmeg and cinnamon. Toasted hazelnuts Long citrus and flinty mineral finish
Very agreeable.... just right... initial impression complex wine, oozing with quality...tastes are discreet, nothing overwhelming...
Delicious and complex Italian white, perfect balance of minerals and acidity. Fresh and rounded, nice finish of green apples and grass
Awesome wine!!! Simply delicious‚Ä¶ let it breathe for 1 hour and you will begin to see the potential! This wine is a power baby!! Cheers
Garnet ruby red with aromas of leather, oak and red fruit. Bold, smooth, dry with flavours of chocolate, vanilla, cherry and red fruit.
Tobacco, mushroom, lavender, anise and red/black fruits. I‚Äôm a lucky lady to be able to try this unexpectedly on Christmas Eve!
Cherries, blackberries, and hints of sweet chocolate and balsamic. Extraordinary vintage. Lovely wine paired with beef daube.
2008 vintage
2009 vintage

Can‚Äôt think of a better wine to be my 400th rating! This wine is a perfect example of the intense flavors that come from the Spring Mountain AVA. Beautiful aromas of ripe black cherry, cranberries and wet concrete. The palate is bountiful of black currant and black cherries with nuances of crushed violet, pencil shavings and forest floor. One of my very favorite wines ever, will show even better in two to three years.
Nose is dark blueberry and blackberry, a taste of dark juicy blueberry, nice an round and a little chocolate on the finish

100% Cabernet Sauvignon from Spring Mountain, Napa Valley. Aged 22 months in 100% new French oak barrels. Attractive aromas of blackberry, plum, cherry, violet, tobacco. Flavors of black fruits, vanilla, chocolate, licorice, anise. Full body, silky tannins, long and fruity finish.
2008 vintage
2009 vintage
Amazing Brunello. Vanilla and red fruit on the nose. Palate of strawberry, oak and leather. Perfectly balance dryness and fruit. Love this wine!
2008 vintage
Had the 2004 this week. So good
Amazing Brunello. Vanilla and red fruit on the nose. Palate of strawberry, oak and leather. Perfectly balance dryness and fruit. Love this wine!

La Piu Belle the goddess of Millahue üá®üá± üç∑ Opaque blackened bloody spooky ruby üëÉ Smoked oaky fog across a graveyard of murdered blackcurrant & blackberry w/ cracked mineral gravestone, herby evil weeds, erry cocoa dust & a raisin port twang for the ferryman üëÑ Med body of creamy blackcurrant vampire blood w/ cocoa, red tortured cherry, squished raspberry, raisin the dead & mineral tomb stone üíÄ üéØ Long nightmare of lingering blackcurrant in deadly chocolate w/ a dry 6ft underground mineral stabbing
Cool Bordeaux blend from Chile. Full bodied blend with dark fruit, chocolate, oak on the pallette. Super long finish, delicate tannins & super approachable! Try this out
Smooth and fruity, incredible intensity of flavours with a port-like heaviness at the end. Very pronounced Petit Verdot violet florality at the finish but not admitted to on the label.

üì£DRINK MORE PRIORATüì£‚Ñ¢Ô∏è #83ü§ó Clos Mogador delivers. Boom! Right there. Didn‚Äôt take that many notes, but the 4.5* was clear. Beautiful stuff. Great structure. Mostly black fruit but also some red berries in the mix. High alcohol but no problem. Tannins are M+ and well-integrated already. Really long finish. Another solid reason to drink more Priorat. Such a reliable quality producer.
Really outstanding liquid, even in its youth. Amazing companion to ib√©rico charcuterie. Great balance of red berries and spices. Nice acidity.
Awesome ruby colored very fruity wine with tones of boysenberry, plum and blueberry. Balsamic nose. I can certainly recommend this one.
2016 vintage
2016 vintage
2016 vintage
4.3... Typical Stag‚Äôs Leap notes. Full of black fruit, cassis, tobacco, and capsicum. Fruity with soft tannins. Impeccably balanced for such a young vintage.

2015 ROCKS !! This particular bottle has always come up a little short for me in the past but the 2015 lives up to the hype! And while this lacks the softer finesse of the 1997 vintage, it doesn't disappoint in complexity with a HUGE array of lip smacking black fruits, lavender, leather & pipe tobacco followed by at least a 2-3 minute finish, treating you to subtle, smoky notes & licorice, all wrapped up in a lush texture. Boom! 93 pts
Side by side of 2013 and 2015: 2013 tart-forward, a bit too tannic for my taste. But 2015: like a vanilla leather cherry blanket. Delicious.
One of my favorite winemakers. Great Cab, big and chewy.

It was over seventy degrees yesterday and Sonja suggested I grill steak! No need to ask twice! after a long winter I broke out the grill in honor of spring, and soon we were having a picnic on the front porch in the nice weather. To pair with the steak, vegetables, and salad, I snagged this wine that I had opened 48 hours earlier. It was no worse for wear. Big and bold, it is packed with black fruit and lavish French oak, with the structure to last. Beautiful, it paired perfectly with steak! Cheers all! üç∑ü•©
2010 vintage

Aching to try this Shiraz again. 05 a decent aged Shiraz though still got lots of life in it. Big big wine üç∑ though not as massive as two hands series. Big and bold and packed with fruits flavors, plum, black berries, leather and spice. Long finishing with velvety tannins

100% Shiraz. On the nose intense ripe black fruits , spices, black cherry, blackcurrants, graphite, white pepper, toasted cedar, on the palate the same fruit flavors, smooth acidity and silky tannin, vanilla, nice mouthfeel with a touch sweetness! 94DSP

4.3. No Nebbiolo tonight KK1, so instead went with a wine you had last month. And you're right...this is at the peak at 15 years. A gorgeous aged Shiraz from Aussie land super producer Ben Glaetzer. Amon-Ra was the Egyptian king of gods. He's probably enjoying a glass right now. üòÅ üç∑ This has blackberry, ripe dark plum, smokey cedar, balsamic and barbecued meat. Bold and rich. Very lush tannins. Drink up! üëç üç∑ üá¶üá∫

Blueberry, slate, and strawberry on the nose. Good, silky mouthfeel. Cherry pipe tobacco upfront. Creme br√ªl√©e in the midrange. Soft tannins and baking spices finish of this very nice wine. Well worth decanting.

4.4. Napa Valley Icons tasting put on by The Cellar in Calgary with 2 ounce viles of six wines. Wine #5 was the one that I anticipated would be WOTN, and while delicious it did finish 2nd. Might be young. Established by Dennis and Judy Groth in the Oakville AVA, Groth Vineyards & Winery had the honor of producing California's first 100-point wine, the 1985 vintage of this wine. The 2016 was #4 on Wine Spectator's Top 100 list for 2019. Waves of flavor including black fruit, nutmeg, chocolate and tobacco.

Freaking gorgeous! I melted upon smelling the bouquet! The layers and waves of blue fruit and black fruit and vanilla and oak and lavender and, just, wow! This is what Napa cab can be in it is so beautiful! Love this wine! Cheers!
DELISH decant for an hour
Another wine that is incredible for the price. Sorry Louise.

It was over seventy degrees yesterday and Sonja suggested I grill steak! No need to ask twice! after a long winter I broke out the grill in honor of spring, and soon we were having a picnic on the front porch in the nice weather. To pair with the steak, vegetables, and salad, I snagged this wine that I had opened 48 hours earlier. It was no worse for wear. Big and bold, it is packed with black fruit and lavish French oak, with the structure to last. Beautiful, it paired perfectly with steak! Cheers all! üç∑ü•©
